Program content: One Year Anniv.

 Scope and Content

Pride and Progress: San Francisco 1. With William Casey, Kory McCormack, and Cheryl Rosenthal 2.Scientists have discovered AIDS drug AZT and vaccine 3.Two men chained themselves to county building after supervisors refused to allocate $50,000 for AIDS services 4.Insurance compoany, Blue Cross has reimbursed patient for experimental AIDS treatments 5.Colorado law makers trying to pass law to quarantine, test, and trace people suspected of being infected with AIDS 6.Sacramento, CA jury selection for a case where four defendents from The Citizens for Medical Justice blocked the entrance of the governsors office who refused to meet and sign law AB3407, which would help protect people sufferening from AIDS 7.Wesley Johnson in Oregon prison was punished for kissing the hand of a visitor COMMERCIAL:Special Valentines Message from GCN 8.Behind the Scenes at GCN 8.COMMERCIAL: Shari Belafonte: San Francisco AIDS Foundation 9.News Week Magazine features a condom advertisement 10.San Francisco Supervisor, Harry Britt address condom advertisments and talks about condoms and risk 11.Great Britain Secretary of State was in San Franciso touring facilities with people with AIDS 12.Nello Carlini interviews Tighe Foley from the Shanti Project 13.San Francisco police department meets with the gay community to talk about safety in regards to socializing, Dianne Christianson from C.U.A.V. talks about safety when leaving bars 14.Sonoma has included AIDS discrimination legislation COMMERCIAL:Special Valentines Message from GCN 15.COMMERCIAL: Mikhail Baryshnikov, Shanti Project COMMERCIAL:San Francisco AIDS Foundation 16. Dr. Nancy Shaw sues University of California because of denied tenure 17.Sally Gearhart Commentary, discussion about the gym 18.GCN Announces 1 Year Anniversary 19.Closing Credits

The Right Stuff: 1. With Danny Williams, talks about GCN's 1st Anniversary COMMERCIAL:Special Valentines Message 2.This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby 3.Footage of GCN 1 Year Anniversary Party featuring Tom Ammiano, Danny Williams, Laurie Bushman, and Mario Mondelli 4. Interview with Mike Hippler from Bay Area Reporter (BAR) 5.Ms. Leather San Francisco Footage 6.Closing Credits

Ward and McCormack discuss recent events affecting the gay and lesbian community. 4. Happy Valentine’s Day, from GCN COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation 5. Ward and McCormack continue discussing recent events. 6. Discussion of a West Virginia Supreme Court case regarding a lesbian teacher 7. Interview with Irene Smith, massage therapist for people with AIDS 8. Speakers with San Francisco AIDS Foundation discuss impact of AIDS on women. 9. Report on Bishop William E. Swing regarding church liturgies for same-sex unions. 10. Report on Dutch National Broadcasting Corporation creation of gay and lesbian [teletext] service.

Interview with Nancy Yerby, who talks about macrobiotic nutrition 5. Interview with Michael Prince, who talks about his music career and his single “Dance Your Love Away”. Includes clip of music video. 6. Happy Valentine’s Day, from GCN 7. Karen Ripley being comedic 8. Promotion of “Poetry & Well-Being” to benefit ACL’s free art classes for people with AIDS 9. Interview with Frank Pike, who talks about his business Moonlighting Escorts. 10. Just Ask Raz COMMERCIAL: Cook’s Magazine COMMERCIAL: The Best of “Money, Money, Money”

Pride and Progress News-highlights: 1. Alexandria, Virginia, Phillip W. Smalley says illicit homosexual remarks as a joke and receives arrest warrant for solicitation and sodomy, potentially faces 5 years in prison 2. Three United State Court of Appeals judges uphold Temple University discriminatory lower court ruling 3. San Francisco gay man on trial for battery and resisting arrest, pleads not guilty 4. South Carolina pornography laws COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation 5. Superior court judge voids ban on bathhouse sex 6. Reagan Republican National Committee spends large sum for California GOP candidate 7. Dr. Silverman, Former Head of San Francisco Public Health and Robin Williams hold press conference opposing proposition 64, includes coverage 8. Metropolitan Church Committee wins right to hold religious services for prisoners 9. Lesbian Caucus holds 2nd annual blood drive, to benefit AIDS patients 10. Mishi Cohen, director of Quan Yin Acupuncture, discusses alternative medicine and AIDS research 11. Sally Gearhart commentary 12. AIDS Bills, AB3667, FB1327, AB31237, AB33233, and AB4249 13. Gay Father's Coalition changes name to The Gay and Lesbian Parents Association International 14. AIDS victim Mark Siegel dies 15. California Closing credits 16. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Michael Shernoff discusses his Safer Sex Workshop 17. Closing credits

The Right Stuff: 1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine COMMERCIAL: Terry Miller, Different Life Bookshop COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation 2. Current events/media/culture, includes clips COMMERCIAL: Interart Theatre 3. Cooking with Esther 4. Closing credits
